meanings.definition: A person or thing that dampens enthusiasm or enjoyment.
meanings.sent1: My little brother can be such a buzzkill when he complains about everything.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather was a real buzzkill for our picnic plans.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat at the party was the ultimate buzzkill, but we still had a good time.
meanings.sent4: Her negative attitude was like a buzzkill cloud hanging over the group's excitement.
meanings.sent5: The constant complaining was a buzzkill that sucked the joy out of the room.

meanings.definition: To spoil or ruin a fun or exciting situation.
meanings.sent1: Please don't buzzkill our movie night by talking loudly on the phone.
meanings.sent2: I hope nothing buzzkills our plans for the weekend getaway.
meanings.sent3: He managed to buzzkill the surprise party by accidentally revealing it to the birthday girl.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected rain buzzkilled our beach day, but we made the best of it.
meanings.sent5: His constant negativity buzzkills any chance of having a good time with him.
